[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Fitness Tracker System (FTS) enables users to set and track fitness goals, monitor workouts, sync data, and receive personalized health insights.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: FTS integrates with fitness wearables, mobile apps, and health platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: FTS provides a web and mobile UI for tracking and goal management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: FTS supports smartphones, tablets, smartwatches, and fitness trackers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: FTS uses REST APIs, secure authentication, and cloud storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: FTS supports alerts and social sharing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: FTS optimizes storage for logs and records.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: FTS allows goal setting, tracking, syncing, and analysis.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: FTS connects with nutrition apps, fitness communities, and coaching platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 MISSING-TAG2: FTS adapts recommendations to user preferences.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: FTS allows users to log workouts, track progress, sync with fitness apps, connect with friends, receive alerts, and access insights.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: FTS serves fitness enthusiasts, athletes, trainers, and health-conscious individuals.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: FTS tracks workouts, monitors goals, syncs data, sends alerts, and provides fitness insights.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: FTS relies on third-party fitness apps, wearable sensors, and cloud storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Fitness Goal: Target for activity improvement.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 MISSING-TAG1: FTS requires internet access for real-time syncing and data updates.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall allow users to set fitness goals, track workouts, and monitor progress.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support synchronization with third-party fitness apps and wearables.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall provide personalized fitness recommendations.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall log workouts with type, duration, calories, and heart rate (REQ-INTF-001, REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall provide real-time progress tracking, alerts, and motivational notifications (REQ-INTF-002, REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall allow users to set reminders for workouts and meals.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall support social features, allowing users to connect, join groups, and compare progress.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI for tracking fitness activities and setting goals.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store workout history, goals, user preferences, and performance data.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process activity logs and sync data within 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support data encryption for privacy protection.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure secure authentication and encrypted storage.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with health data privacy regulations.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests validate goal setting, workout tracking, syncing, alerts, and user engagement.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Health tracking standards, wearable device integration, and data privacy policies.
